task.title: Create a Security Group
task.shortdesc: Eucalyptus enables you to control access to your cloud using security groups. A security group contains a group of rules that control inbound traffic to instances in the group for the specified protocols and ports.

task.title: Create a Security Group with the Console

step.cmd: Enter a name for your security group in the Name text box.
Enter a description for your security group in the Description text box.
Create one or more rules for the security group. A rule grants inbound access to a port or port range for a specified protocol.

substep.cmd: Select a protocol for the rule from the Protocol drop-down list box.
Enter a port range for the rule in the Port range text box.
Select the type of inbound traffic for the rule using the radio buttons:

info.p: To grant access to an IP address or range of IP addresses, select the IP Address radio button and enter a CIDR range in the text box.
info.note: For more information on CIDR notation, please see the CIDR notation Wikipedia article.
info.p: To grant access to another security group, select the Other security group radio button and enter the name of the security group in the text box.
To grant access to only to other instances in this security group, select the Other instances in this security group radio button.

substep.cmd: Click the Add another rule button.
